name: Silver Fizz
description: Fizzes were introduced as morning drinks in the 19th century, eye-opening hangover remedies with the added benefit of a bit of egg white to help it all go down. It's simply a Tom Collins chilled and shaken with egg white, served without ice (fizzes are designed to be consumed fairly quickly, not lingered over for a half-hour).
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon sugar (or 2 teaspoons simple syrup), to taste
1 fresh egg white (if you're mixing with friends, one egg white is good for two drinks)

recipeInstructions.text: In a cocktail shaker, dissolve the sugar in the lemon juice; add the gin and egg white and shake, without ice, for about 10 seconds to give the egg white some froth. Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for a good 10 seconds, to work up the foam. Strain into a chilled Collins glass and top with about 2 ounces of club soda. If you're in the mood for it, dash some bitters atop the foam.
